channel.title: Could somebody explain me
channel.description:
well hello there my name is Dennis first off i wanna say sorry about my grammer (it sucks)
and i actualy wonder how i can start coding rsps i know hot to code java but i need to know what the ints means on rsps
like handlecombat int what it actualy is or if there is actualy a list where you can see what it means

item.title: Could somebody explain me
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Kryptix:

I’ve never understood how or why people claim they know Java but don’t know how to ‘code’ RSPS. Surely it’s just like picking up any other Java project?

I thought the reverse was the case around here?

Read full topic

item.title: Could somebody explain me
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

I’ve never understood how or why people claim they know Java but don’t know how to ‘code’ RSPS. Surely it’s just like picking up any other Java project?

Read full topic

item.title: Could somebody explain me
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“iKilem, post:8, topic:443031”][quote author=_s link=topic=545719.msg4003122#msg4003122 date=1338295429]

What I’m saying is, people should document their code before releasing it to the public.

http://www.inze.be/andries/2008/06/21/good-code-doesnt-need-comments/ might be of interest to you
[/quote]
So when he needs to comment inside a method body, he just creates a separate method instead? That doesn’t sound like a very good practice (where’s the logic behind it?), especially if it requires passing several arguments to a method.[/quote]in the multiple-argument case i highly doubt he does the same, but i see the gist of the article as being supportive of focusing on preferring to give a descriptive name to code which may be a composition of simple things, such as a bunch of comparisons, to increase readability. of course, maybe Java’s ‘way’ makes it so that usage of this technique is constrained and people will argue against using methods in such a way, but i do personally like it although probably because it’s effectively the norm in functional languages, splitting up complex logic into small named units/functions and composing. i’m biased

Read full topic

item.title: Could somebody explain me
item.dc:creator: @iKilem iKilem
item.description:
@iKilem wrote:

[quote="_s, post:7, topic:443031"][quote author=ytuio9` link=topic=545719.msg4003019#msg4003019 date=1338271328]
What I’m saying is, people should document their code before releasing it to the public.
[/quote]
http://www.inze.be/andries/2008/06/21/good-code-doesnt-need-comments/ might be of interest to you[/quote]
So when he needs to comment inside a method body, he just creates a separate method instead? That doesn’t sound like a very good practice (where’s the logic behind it?), especially if it requires passing several arguments to a method.

Read full topic

item.title: Could somebody explain me
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

You can also use an int like this:

int combatLevel = 3;
int maxCombatLevel = 126;

if (combatLevel > maxCombatLevel) {
        combatLevel = maxCombatLevel;
}

As you can see, in RS the max combat level you can have is 126. When calculating your combat level with certain formulas, the calculation might be a bit off, so you take the precaution of checking if the player’s combat level is more than 126, to display it just as 126.

Read full topic

item.title: Could somebody explain me
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:

What I’m saying is, people should document their code before releasing it to the public.

item.title: Could somebody explain me
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

You’d have to look into other parts of code to determine what the integers are used for. Each server base is going to use different variable names and data types, which is why you should work on building most of the server yourself. You won’t find a list defining how each named variable is used, if that’s what you’re asking.

Read full topic

item.title: Could somebody explain me
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

I agree, wtf is a handleCombat? What is this poorly documented unmaintainable piece of shit?

(inb4 http://thc.org/root/phun/unmaintain.html)

Read full topic

item.title: Could somebody explain me
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Ints, as in Integers, a primitive variable type? You can declare them by:

int anInt = 2;

Unless you are referring to model definitions on a client.

Read full topic
